update.description:
Issue #1299 was initially fixed by pull request #1232, but there was an error in that fix. Specifically, there was an error in the regular expression used to parse the `gzserver` process id (pid) from the `ps` command output. Here's an example of `ps` command output with pid of 12345:
~~~
12345 ?        Sl     4:56 gzserver /tmp/clone.11347.world
~~~

This mistake was that the regular expression didn't allow for whitespace at the beginning of the line, but this can happen if a process id has a smaller number of digits than the system maximum. For example, the following was logged from my computer that has initial whitespace and [shows a python error in the log file](https://gist.github.com/scpeters/a355665271490e81c381):
~~~
 9980 ?        Sl     1:23 gzserver /tmp/clone.11347.world
~~~
This pull request fixes the regular expression and adds some logic to verify that the `re.search` command was successful.

I ran a [jenkins test](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-ati/116/) of branch issue_1299_failtest, which was patched in a28957b642c to force failures of the `INTEGRATION_world_clone` test that leaves `gzserver`'s behind. It sucessfully killed the rogue process.
update.title: Prevent rogue gzserver's after failed INTEGRATION_world_clone tests, update (#1299)

content.raw:
I just made another change: moving the code block to the beginning of the function, since there is a `sys.exit()` call in one of the other code blocks that would prevent this code from running.

I discovered this based on a [recent failure](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/377).
content.html:
I just made another change: moving the code block to the beginning of the function, since there is a sys.exit() call in one of the other code blocks that would prevent this code from running.

I discovered this based on a recent failure.

pull_request.title: Prevent rogue gzserver's after failed INTEGRATION_world_clone tests, update (#1299)
